page.title: 04Mr.Powell, the Forester
page.content: A man called Mr.Powell came to talk to us about the Forestry Commission. {In the whole of the Forest there are {about 27000 acres, 22500 of which are {used for timber production. The Forest {is carefully managed with a balance of {45% deciduous and 55% coniferous trees {being maintained.Mr Powell told us the {trees are a living renewable resource. Mr. Powell's job is concerned with recreation, tourism and fencing of old mine shafts some of which are 200m deep.He told us about forest fires and litter bugs. He said tourists don't leave much litter,but the local people leave fridges, cookers, sinks and tumble dryers lying around in the forest. They are starting to put up fencing to keep the sheep out of Cinderford but it is not doing any good because the local council will not put cattle grids across the roads
